posts.post_content:
Instead of pricing these cards individually, I'm just starting them all at $17 each and whenever I bump the thread, I'll drop the price $1 each. Paypal gift/friend only on these and shipping is $5 no matter how many you take. Feel free to make offers on multiple cards. There are some steals in here, check the labels for details on some cards. Have at it gentlemen!

****Available cards listed in last post****

Remaining cards are all $18 each. Some interesting cards up there, a couple Hal Chase, Vic Willis, some partial double names. Sold cards are listed above the scans. Same rules apply, one time $5 shipping charge for any amount of cards and paypal friend/gift please. Thanks

Lowered price. Still 38 left, sold ones listed above. Thanks for looking

All 38 can be had for $550 dlvd...according to my abacus, that is $14.47 each.

posts.post_title: pm sent--would like these 5 please (in pm)

posts.post_content: 33 cards left now. Sold cards listed above the scans. I'll update the scans next time. $460 can take all that is left including a Willis and two Chase cards!
Me thinks I priced mine too low....

I've sold nine in two weeks, so I don't think prices are strong on T206's. Obviously some of these cards are worth less than $17 apiece and that's why they are still for sale, but some of them definitely should have sold by now. Eventually I'll get down to a reasonable price for the lower grade ones, but I'm in no rush at this time.

I agree, z, if you're saying that the market is down on T206's; it's seemed so to me for a couple of months.  I wondered if it would go up at the end of the baseball season [with more hobby-time for many fantasy players like me], but it hasn't seemed to, yet.  
I've made some good buys on ebay--better buys than on Net54--but I've had pretty much the same results as you on my B/S/T thread [which I haven't updated for a couple of weeks].  
I am interested in one of yours; I'll send you an email.

Doug
